item.title: 澳大利亚电视公司 Foxtel 被新闻集团出售
item.description: 澳大利亚付费电视公司 Foxtel 由默多克家族控制，部分股权由当地电信公司 Telstra 持有，其所有者新闻集团（News Corp）周四表示，由于第三方的兴趣和战略审查，该公司已被出售。【原文：Australian pay television company Foxtel, controlled by the Murdoch family and partly by local telecom firm Telstra , has been put up for sale post third-party interest and a strategic review, owner News Corp said on Thursday.】

item.title: 穆迪下调英特尔高级无担保评级
item.description: 穆迪（Moody's）周四将英特尔的高级无担保评级从之前的 A3 下调至 BAA1，理由是担心这家芯片制造商的盈利能力。【原文：Moody's downgraded Intel's senior unsecured rating on Thursday to BAA1 from its earlier A3 rating, citing concerns about the chipmaker's profitability.】

item.title: 美联储施密德表示更有信心通胀率达到 2% 的目标
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫-施密德（Jeff Schmid）是美国央行中较为鹰派的决策者之一，他在周四表示，最近 "令人鼓舞 "的数据让他对通胀降温更有信心，并为美联储降息做好了准备。【原文：Kansas City Federal Reserve Bank President Jeff Schmid, one of the U.S. central bank's more hawkish policymakers, said on Thursday that recent "encouraging" data gives him more confidence that inflation is cooling and sets the table for a reduction in the Fed's interest rate.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长称将 "不惜一切代价 "控制通胀
item.description: 巴西央行货币政策主管加布里埃尔-加里波洛（Gabriel Galipolo）周四表示，巴西央行将 "不惜一切代价 "控制通胀，并补充说通胀风险似乎高于其3%的目标。【原文：Brazil's central bank will do "whatever is necessary" to control inflation, monetary policy director Gabriel Galipolo said on Thursday, adding that risks appeared to be to the upside of its 3% target.】

item.title: 早间竞标：乐观情绪升温，但中国通胀迫在眉睫
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 由于国际旅游需求持续增长，Expedia 第二季度利润超出预期
item.description: 受国际旅游需求持续增长的影响，在线旅行社 Expedia 周四公布的第二季度利润超出分析师预期，盘后股价上涨 7%。【原文：Online travel agency Expedia beat analysts' expectations on Thursday for second-quarter profit, helped by sustained demand for international travel, sending its shares up 7% after the bell.】

item.title: 芝加哥联储古尔斯比表示，美联储对经济数据而非政治或股票作出反应
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周四重申，央行的工作不是应对股市溃败或政治因素【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Austan Goolsbee on Thursday reiterated that the central bank's job is not to respond to stock market routs or political considerations】

item.title: 新闻集团第四季度收入超出预期
item.description: 受道琼斯商业信息部门数字订阅增长的帮助，媒体集团新闻集团周四公布的第四季度营收超出华尔街预期。【原文：Media conglomerate News Corp beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue on Thursday, helped by digital subscription growth at its Dow Jones business information unit.】

item.title: Take-Two Interactive 预测第二季度预订额低于预期，原因是游戏支出疲软
item.description: 视频游戏出版商 Take-Two Interactive Software 周四预测第二季度预订额低于华尔街预期，这表明在经济不确定的情况下，其《侠盗猎车手》和《NBA 2K》等热门游戏的消费疲软。【原文：Videogame publisher Take-Two Interactive Software forecast second-quarter bookings below Wall Street expectations on Thursday, a sign of sluggish spending on its popular titles such as "Grand Theft Auto" and "NBA 2K" in an uncertain economy.】

item.title: 空中出租车制造商 Archer 计划最早于 2026 年在洛杉矶推出空中交通网络
item.description: 阿切尔航空公司（Archer Aviation）周四表示，它计划在洛杉矶启动一个空中交通网络，最早将于 2026 年开始运营。【原文：Archer Aviation said on Thursday it plans to launch an air mobility network in Los Angeles, with operations beginning as early as 2026.】

item.title: 化妆品和护肤品需求保持稳定，Elf Beauty上调年度预期
item.description: 精灵美容公司周四上调了年度销售额和利润预期，高于第一季度预期，原因是越来越多的顾客到商店和网站购买其物美价廉的化妆品和护肤品。【原文：Elf Beauty raised annual sales and profit forecasts after topping first-quarter estimates on Thursday, as more customers visited stores and websites to buy its affordable cosmetics and skincare products.】

item.title: 吉利德公司季度利润超出市场预期，收入增长 5
item.description: 吉利德科学公司（Gilead Sciences）周四公布的第二季度利润大幅超出华尔街预期，主要得益于较低的运营费用和较高的产品销售额，该制药商还上调了对全年收益的展望。【原文：Gilead Sciences on Thursday reported second-quarter profit that handily beat Wall Street estimates, driven by lower operating expenses and higher product sales, and the drugmaker raised its outlook for full-year earnings.】

item.title: 派拉蒙全球公司减记有线电视网络价值，首次实现流媒体盈利
item.description: 派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）周四将其有线电视网络的价值减记了近 60 亿美元，尽管该公司的流媒体业务报告首次实现了季度盈利。【原文：Paramount Global wrote down the value of its cable networks by nearly $6 billion on Thursday, even as the company's streaming business reported its first quarterly profit.】

item.title: 纳斯达克考虑制定更严格的仙股退市规则
item.description: 纳斯达克周四在其网站上发布的一份文件显示，纳斯达克正在提议修订其有关仙股的规则，以便对违规公司实施更快、更严格的退市程序。【原文：Nasdaq is proposing amendments to its rules pertaining to penny stocks to put a faster, more stringent delisting process in place for non-compliant companies, according to a filing posted on the exchange operator's website on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔金认为通胀回落，是时候评估政策了
item.description: 里士满联邦储备银行行长托马斯-巴尔金（Thomas Barkin）周四表示，美国劳动力市场的降温是由于招聘放缓而非裁员增加，这使得央行可以考虑下一步行动。 "巴尔金在全美证券协会举办的一次虚拟活动上说："实际上，我对未来几个月我们将看到通胀方面的良好读数相当乐观。【原文：Richmond Federal Reserve Bank President Thomas Barkin on Thursday said that cooling in the U.S. labor market is coming from slower hiring rather than a rise in layoffs, allowing the central bank to figure out its next move. "I'm actually pretty optimistic that over the next few months we're going to see good readings on the inflation side," Barkin said at a virtual event put on by the National Ass】

item.title: 报告显示，房贷利率下降吸引谨慎购房者重返房市
item.description: 房地产经纪公司Redfin周四发布的一份报告显示，抵押贷款利率降至一年多以来的低点，促使一些潜在购房者重新开始找房。【原文：A drop in mortgage rates to over one-year lows has prompted some prospective buyers to resume house-hunting, a report from real estate brokerage Redfin showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普称总统应对美联储决策拥有发言权
item.description: 共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普周四表示，美国总统应该对美联储的决策拥有发言权。【原文：Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said on Thursday that U.S. presidents should have a say over decisions made by the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 墨西哥央行在分歧投票中将基准利率下调至 10.75
item.description: 墨西哥货币管理局周四宣布，墨西哥央行将基准利率下调至 10.75%，投票结果存在分歧，关键借贷利率从 11.00% 下调。【原文：Mexico's central bank lowered its benchmark interest rate to 10.75%, the monetary authority announced on Thursday, in a divided vote that cut the key borrowing rate from 11.00%.】

item.title: 达美航空警告称 CrowdStrike 中断将导致 3.8 亿美元收入受挫
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）周四警告说，CrowdStrike 造成的网络中断将导致该公司本季度收入减少 3.8 亿美元。【原文：Delta Air Lines on Thursday warned of a $380 million hit to its revenue in the current quarter from operational disruptions resulting from the CrowdStrike-caused outage.】

item.title: 波动性阻碍了期权市场对盈利推动美股波动的押注
item.description: 一种押注个股在公司业绩公布后出现超预期走势的期权策略在本财报季大获全胜，但本周的波动率飙升却让这一策略偏离了正常轨道。【原文：An options strategy that bets on individual stocks logging larger-than-expected moves after corporate results was winning big this earnings season but is among many that has been derailed by this week’s volatility spike.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称印度信实公司与委内瑞拉达成原油换石脑油交易
item.description: 三位了解合同条款的消息人士称，印度信实工业公司（Reliance Industries）在上个月获得美国批准恢复与委内瑞拉的石油贸易后，计划用供应的石脑油作为从委内瑞拉购买原油的部分付款。【原文：India's Reliance Industries plans to use naptha supplies as partial payment for crude purchases from Venezuela after the refiner obtained a U.S. approval last month to resume oil trade with the sanctioned producer, three sources aware of the contract terms said.】

item.title: 薪酬专家称，华尔街投行奖金最高可能上涨 35
item.description: 华尔街薪酬分析公司 Johnson Associates 在一份报告中称，从事债务承销的投资银行家今年的奖金可能会增加 25% 至 35%，而负责首次公开募股的银行家 2024 年的奖金可能会增加 20% 至 30%。【原文：Investment bankers working on debt underwriting may see bonuses climb by 25% to 35% this year, and bankers handling initial public offerings could see a 20% to 30% jump in 2024, Johnson Associates, a Wall Street compensation analysis firm said in a report.】

item.title: 瑞安航空增加股票回购计划，原因是交付延迟增加了现金流
item.description: 瑞安航空（Ryanair）周四表示，由于现金状况强于预期，部分原因是新波音飞机的延迟交付，公司将在未来六到九个月内回购多达 8 亿欧元（8.7248 亿美元）的股票。【原文：Ryanair said on Thursday it would buy back up to 800 million euros ($872.48 million) more of its shares over the next six to nine months due to a stronger than expected cash position, driven partly by the delayed delivery of new Boeing aircraft.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，网络安全公司趋势科技正在探索出售事宜
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周四表示，市值约 9500 亿日元（65 亿美元）的日本网络安全公司趋势科技（Trend Micro）在吸引了收购兴趣后，正在探索出售事宜。【原文：Trend Micro , a Japanese cybersecurity firm with a market value of about 950 billion yen ($6.5 billion), is exploring a sale after attracting buyout interest, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 通用汽车表示，尽管面临挑战，但仍将致力于在华运营
item.description: 通用汽车公司周四表示，尽管面临来自本土品牌的激烈竞争，该公司仍将致力于在中国建立一个盈利且可自我维持的业务。【原文：General Motors said on Thursday it was committed to building a profitable and self-sustainable operation in China, despite facing stiff competition from local brands.】

item.title: 美国商品期货交易委员会称，加密货币交易所 FTX 被勒令向客户支付 127 亿美元
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会周四表示，美国法院已下令破产的加密货币交易所 FTX 向其客户支付 127 亿美元救济金。【原文：A U.S. court has ordered bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX to pay $12.7 billion in relief to its customers, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission said on Thursday.】

item.title: 苹果公司在欧盟委员会调查后修改欧盟应用商店政策
item.description: 苹果公司周四改变了其在欧盟的政策，允许开发人员在应用程序之外与客户交流，此前欧盟委员会于 6 月份指控这家 iPhone 制造商违反了欧盟的技术规则。【原文：Apple on Thursday changed its policy in the European Union to allow developers to communicate with their customers outside the app after the Commission charged the iPhone maker in June for breaching the bloc's tech rules.】

item.title: 独家报道嘉吉公司内部备忘录描述了为精简公司而进行的结构性改革
item.description: 据路透社和两位公司消息人士看到的一份公司内部文件显示，全球贸易公司嘉吉（Cargill）在未能实现内部盈利目标后将进行结构调整，计划将业务部门从五个精简为三个。【原文：Global trading house Cargill will undergo structural changes after missing internal earnings goals, with plans to streamline operations into three units instead of five, according to an internal company document seen by Reuters and two company sources.】

item.title: X 同意不使用部分欧盟用户数据来训练人工智能聊天机器人
item.description: 爱尔兰一家法院周四审理了这起案件，社交媒体平台 X 同意暂时不使用从欧盟用户那里收集到的个人数据来训练其人工智能系统，因为在此之前，用户可以选择撤销同意。【原文：Social media platform X agreed on Thursday not to train its AI systems for now using the personal data collected from European Union users before they had the option to withdraw their consent, an Irish court heard on Thursday.】

item.title: X 处理英国骚乱的方式可能会影响欧盟调查
item.description: 一位发言人说，欧盟委员会正在对社交媒体平台 X 进行调查，调查可能会考虑到该平台对与最近英国骚乱有关的有害内容的处理方式。【原文：An ongoing European Commission investigation into social media platform X could take its handling of harmful content related to the recent UK riots into account, a spokesperson said.】
